oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Joe and Katherine Lehman interview
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lehman, Joe; Lehman, Katherine
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Joe Lehman was a journalism professor, headed the news bureau, and served as the first director of The American University in Cairo Press, accompanied by his wife Katherine Lehman in Cairo from 1959 to 1961. Joe Lehman tells of being recruited from President Raymond McLain’s former institution, Transylvania College in Pennsylvania, USA to teach journalism, and discusses students’ production of the Caravan student newspaper and commencement issue. He also speaks of the university’s academic reorganization, humanities and social-science focus, and composition of the student body. Lehman discusses AUC’s publicity and fundraising strategy and the news bureau’s production of promotional material like publications and a film aimed at American audiences. The establishment and first years of the AUC Press are described, including its early activities and publications under Lehman’s directorship. Katherine Lehman offers a fond recollection of her time at AUC and in Cairo, mentioning her association with Dean of Students Beatrice McLain, and the couple both comment on faculty social life in Cairo.
